headline.main: Police: 2 Women Arrested After Fight on JetBlue Flight

headline.main: Colombia Rebel Pleads Guilty in U.S. to Hostage Taking
headline.print_headline: Colombia Rebel Pleads Guilty in U.S. to Hostage Taking

docs.snippet: A member of the Colombian FARC rebel group pleaded guilty in U.S. federal court to hostage-taking charges stemming from the 2003 kidnappings of three U.S. citizens in Colombia, the U.S. Justice Department said on Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A member of the Colombian FARC rebel group pleaded guilty in U.S. federal court to hostage-taking charges stemming from the 2003 kidnappings of three U.S. citizens in Colombia, the U.S. Justice Department said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Novo Nordisk Adding Diabetes Drug Output in NC, Denmark
headline.print_headline: Novo Nordisk Adding Diabetes Drug Output in NC, Denmark

byline.original: By FRITZIE ANDRADE, MARK ESPLIN, MIKHAIL GALUSTOV, WILL LLOYD and MURAT SENURKMEZ

docs.lead_paragraph: The less-harried Asian side of Istanbul is a greener, cleaner swath of the city that offers its own multicultural mix of Ottoman palaces, intriguing cuisine and hipster night life.

headline.main: Bruising Sell-Off Tests Market Faith in Central Banks
headline.print_headline: Bruising Sell-Off Tests Market Faith in Central Banks

docs.snippet: A bruising 48-hour sell-off in global stocks driven by fears of slowing growth has rocked market confidence in central bankers' ability to fight deflation, restore economic health and keep a six-year-old bull run going....
docs.lead_paragraph: A bruising 48-hour sell-off in global stocks driven by fears of slowing growth has rocked market confidence in central bankers' ability to fight deflation, restore economic health and keep a six-year-old bull run going.

headline.main: Haiti Drought Cuts Harvests, Lifts Prices, Food Crisis Looms: WFP
headline.print_headline: Haiti Drought Cuts Harvests, Lifts Prices, Food Crisis Looms: WFP

docs.snippet: A severe drought in Haiti has led to acute water shortages, shriveled harvests and raised food prices, weakening the fragile food supply and worsening hunger among the poor, the U.N. World Food Programme (WFP) said....
docs.lead_paragraph: A severe drought in Haiti has led to acute water shortages, shriveled harvests and raised food prices, weakening the fragile food supply and worsening hunger among the poor, the U.N. World Food Programme (WFP) said.
